Kasus Desa Siluman Dapat Rp 1 Miliar, Jokowi: Kejar dan Tangkap
06 Nov 2019, 22:28 by Caesar Akbar, Ali Akhmad Noor Hidayat
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Presiden Joko Widodo atau Jokowi mengatakan pemerintah akan mengejar dan mendalami laporan adanya desa tak berpenduduk, namun mendapat kucuran dana desa sebesar Rp 1 miliar. "Tetap kita kejar agar yang namanya desa-desa tadi, yang diperkirakan atau diduga itu fiktif ketemu, ketangkap," ujar dia di Jakarta International Expo, Jakarta, Rabu, 6 November 2019.
Jokowi mengatakan perkara desa fiktif itu bisa terjadi lantaran negara Indonesia yang luas, terdiri atas 514 kabupaten dan kota. Total ada sekitar 74.800 desa di Tanah Air. Sehingga, ia mengatakan pengelolaan desa sebanyak itu memang tidak mudah. "Bisa saja terjadi karena dari Sabang sampai Merauke, dari Miangas sampai Pulau Rote, sebuah pengelolaan yang tidak mudah," kata Jokowi.
Sebelumnya, Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati mengatakan dirinya bakal melakukan investigasi mengenai adanyan laporan desa tak berpenduduk, namun mendapat kucuran dana desa sebesar Rp 1 miliar. Dia mengatakan mendengar kabar ini usai mengikuti rapat perdana kabinet.
"Kami mendengarnya sesudah pembentukan kabinet dan nanti akan kami investigasi," kata Sri Mulyani usai mengikuti rapat kerja dengan Dewan Perwakilan Rakyat (DPR) di Kompleks Parlemen, Senayan, Senin 4 November 2019.
Dalam rapat kerja bersama dengan Komisi Keuangan DPR, Sri Mulyani mengungkapan adanya laporan terkait desa fiktif tersebut. Dia mengatakan desa tersebut mendapat jatah dana desa namun nyatanya tak berpenduduk.
Desa yang fiktif tersebut bisa muncul diduga sebagai modus supaya bisa mendapat bagian dan memanfaatkan dana desa. Menurut Sri Mulyani, ini bisa muncul sejalan tugas ajek pemerintah yang hanya menyalurkan dana desa ke kepada desa tanpa peninjauan lebih ketat.
Menurut Sri Mulyani, desa fiktif tersebut dilakukan dengan cara mengusulkan pengajuan dana desa, namun desa tersebut baru dibuat belakangan. Karena itu, dirinya akan melakukan inventarisasi desa-desa bersama dengan Menteri Dalam Negeri untuk mencegah hal ini berlanjut.

CAESAR AKBAR | DIAS PRASONGKO

The Siluman Village Case Get Rp. 1 Billion, Jokowi: Chase and Catch
Nov 6 2019, 22:28 by Caesar Akbar, Ali Akhmad Noor Hidayat
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - President Joko Widodo or Jokowi said the government would pursue and explore reports of uninhabited villages, but received village funding of Rp 1 billion. "We are still pursuing that the names of the villages, which were expected or suspected to be fictitious, were captured," he said at the Jakarta International Expo, Jakarta, Wednesday, November 6, 2019.
Jokowi said the fictitious village case could occur because of the vast Indonesian state, consisting of 514 districts and cities. In total there are around 74,800 villages in the country. So, he said management of that many villages was indeed not easy. "It could happen because from Sabang to Merauke, from Miangas to Rote Island, a management that is not easy," Jokowi said.
Previously, Minister of Finance Sri Mulyani Indrawati said that she would investigate the report on villages without residents, but received a village fund of Rp 1 billion. He said that he heard this news after attending the inaugural cabinet meeting.
"We heard after the formation of the cabinet and we will investigate later," Sri Mulyani said after attending a working meeting with the House of Representatives (DPR) in the Parliament Complex, Senayan, Monday, November 4, 2019.
In a joint working meeting with the DPR Finance Commission, Sri Mulyani revealed a report related to the fictitious village. He said the village was allocated village funds but in fact it was not populated.
The fictitious village could emerge as a mode of being able to get a share and utilize village funds. According to Sri Mulyani, this could emerge in line with the task of the government subject to only channeling village funds to the village without a closer look.
According to Sri Mulyani, the fictitious village was carried out by proposing proposals for village funds, but the village was only created later. Therefore, he will conduct an inventory of villages together with the Minister of the Interior to prevent this from continuing.

CAESAR AKBAR | DIAS PRASONGKO
